intro: Gymnostyles lusitanica, commonly known as the Portuguese rush, is a flowering plant species native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its cylindrical, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that develop in dense clusters. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, preferring moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight sheen, contributing to its adaptability in wetland environments. Gymnostyles lusitanica plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and semi-aquatic organisms.
